alert.note: Alert for Dolores; Montrose; San Miguel (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 23 at 6:54PM MST until February 23 at 7:30PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Dolores County in southwestern Colorado... Northwestern San Miguel County in southwestern Colorado... Southwestern Montrose County in west central Colorado... Northeastern San Juan County in southeastern Utah... * Until 730 PM MST. * At 653 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Slick Rock to 14 miles west of Monticello, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 71 and 103. U.S. Highway 491 in Utah between mile markers 0 and 16. Colorado 90 between mile markers 1 and 5, and between mile markers 19 and 30. Colorado 141 between mile markers 12 and 25. Locations impacted include... Monticello, La Sal, Slick Rock, Ucolo, Summit Point and La Sal Junction. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
